thread.title: ‘Mr. President, Back Off’: Greta Van Susteren Responds to Trump’s ‘Enemy’ Tweet
thread.title_full: ‘Mr. President, Back Off’: Greta Van Susteren Responds to Trump’s ‘Enemy’ Tweet

author: Josh Feldman
title: ‘Mr. President, Back Off’: Greta Van Susteren Responds to Trump’s ‘Enemy’ Tweet
text:
‘Mr. President, Back Off’: Greta Van Susteren Responds to Trump’s ‘Enemy’ Tweet by Josh Feldman | 10:13   
MSNBC’s Greta Van Susteren ended her show today with brief commentary on President Trump ‘s feud with the press, with words of criticism for both sides. 
Van Susteren talked about the importance of a free press and how America holds that up as one of its most important values. 
However, she said, journalists need to have a greater sense of responsibility: 
“We should forever be doing a vigorous self-examination of how we do our jobs, because getting it wrong or exaggerating just is not an option.” 
But she went on to respond to Trump, saying, “Mr. President, back off. You likewise need to do a self-examination. You need to get it right too.” 
She brought up his recent “last night in Sweden” misstep and his “reckless tweets” and the serious cost all of those things have, telling him it’s “dead wrong to rev up your loyal base with incorrect, generalized, and wide-sweeping inflammatory statements about the entire media.” 
Watch above, via MSNBC.
